intro: Cardamine brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian watercress, is a flowering plant species native to South America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many other aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Due to its high nutrient content, it is sometimes used in local cuisines and traditional medicine.
